item.title: PI Cant login
item.dc:creator: @I_InDrEk_I I InDrEk I
item.description:
@I_InDrEk_I wrote:

[quote=“belhelmiel, post:2, topic:402019”][quote author=I InDrEk I link=topic=499073.msg3649579#msg3649579 date=1309639076]
I cant login, i changed ip, compiled. I made webclient and it didnt work. Didnt work to normal client either. I tryed with other source and client it works. I changed the ip in client.java there arent gui.java or egui.java.

PS. Im using runeverfix.
[/quote]
change the ip in client.java to 127.0.0.1. Then try logging in. That is the local host. The webclients .jar also has to have the ip as 127.0.0.1 until you portforward and put it online for everyone to use. Remember that if you use hamachi u cant use the webclient. good luck hope it helped :3[/quote]Dumb… you can use webclient with hamachi i had server running. But this i wanted to make for my friend. And i changed the ip to 127.0.0.1 and he couldnt login.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Cant login
item.dc:creator: @Mr.czar Mr.czar
item.description:
@Mr.czar wrote:

lol? if it was a weclient it would be online lol… so why would you change the webclients ip to 127.0.0.1? LOL

item.title: PI Cant login
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

[quote=“I InDrEk I, post:1, topic:402019”]I cant login, i changed ip, compiled. I made webclient and it didnt work. Didnt work to normal client either. I tryed with other source and client it works. I changed the ip in client.java there arent gui.java or egui.java.

PS. Im using runeverfix.[/quote]
change the ip in client.java to 127.0.0.1. Then try logging in. That is the local host. The webclients .jar also has to have the ip as 127.0.0.1 until you portforward and put it online for everyone to use. Remember that if you use hamachi u cant use the webclient. good luck hope it helped :3

Read full topic
